title: Ensure 'Allow Administrator account lockout' is set to 'Enabled'
description: This policy setting determines whether the built-in Administrator account is subject to the account lockout policy. Only the built-in Administrator account is affected by this policy setting, and it is useful for preventing brute-force attacks on the Administrator account.

gpo_config.policy_path: Computer Configuration\Policies\Windows Settings\Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy

impact.description: If the Administrator account is locked out, you may need to use another administrative account to unlock it, or wait for the lockout duration to expire.

rationale: Enabling this setting prevents the Administrator account from being used to brute-force passwords without risk of lockout.
notes: This is a manual rule check.
